Math

Contains subroutines to assist in certain mathematical calculations

Functions
CalculateMidpoint
call Math.CalculateMidpoint(
point1,
point2,
&center
);

Find the center between two points.

Parameters
point1

The first point

point2

The second point

Response Parameters
&center

the midpoint between point1 and point2

TransformPoint
call Math.TransformPoint(
p0x,
p0y,
angleInDegrees,
&px,
&py
);

Rotate a point a given number of degrees and return the new position

Parameters
p0x

starting X position

p0y

starting Y position

angleInDegrees

magnitude (in degrees) of rotation

Response Parameters
&px

ending X position

&py

ending Y position

ClearBit
call Math.ClearBit(
registerIn,
bitIndex,
&registerOut
);

Zero out a given index in a register

Parameters
registerIn

the starting number

bitIndex

the index of the bit to set to 0

Response Parameters
&registerOut

the resulting number

Notes

This function is equivalent to

registerOut = registerIn &  ~(1 << bitIndex)
SetBit
call Math.SetBit(
registerIn,
bitIndex,
&registerOut
);

Set a given index in a register

Parameters
registerIn

the starting number

bitIndex

the index of the register to set to 1

Response Parameters
&registerOut

the resulting number

Notes

This function is equivalent to

registerOut = registerIn | 1 << bitIndex;
GetBit
call Math.GetBit(
registerIn,
bitIndex,
&bitValue
);

Query if a given bit in a register is high or low

Parameters
registerIn

the starting number

bitIndex

the index of the register to get

Response Parameters
&bitValue

the resulting number

Notes

This function is equivalent to

bitValue = (registerIn & ( 1 << bitIndex )) >> bitIndex
VectorToUnitVector
call Math.VectorToUnitVector(
ni,
nj,
nk,
&nui,
&nuj,
&nuk,
&result
);

Convert a vector to a unit vector

Parameters
ni

the first vector point

nj

the second vector point

nk

the third vector point

Response Parameters
&nui

the first unit vector point

&nuj

the second unit vector point

&nuk

the third unit vector point

&result

whether the conversion was successful or not

TriggerBitHighLow
call Math.TriggerBitHighLow(
registerIn,
bitIndex,
bitHighTime
);

Set the given index in a register to 1 for a specified amount of time, and then to 0.  If the bit is already high, it will still be set low after the time elapses.

Parameters
registerIn

the starting number

bitIndex

the index of the bit to set high

bitHighTime

the wait time in seconds before setting the bit to low

TriggerBitLowHigh
call Math.TriggerBitLowHigh(
registerIn,
bitIndex,
bitHighTime
);

Set the given index in a register to 0 for a specified amount of time, and then to 1.  If the bit is already low, it will still be set high after the time elapses.

Parameters
registerIn

the starting number

bitIndex

the index of the register to set low

bitHighTime

the wait time in seconds before setting the bit to high
